billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO RACING, GAMING AND WAGERING

title: Makes certain exceptions for the issuance of licenses for the conduct of games of bingo
summary: Makes certain exceptions for the issuance of licenses for the conduct of games of bingo for rehabilitation programs licensed or certified by a state agency and conducted by an applicant providing such rehabilitation programs or an affiliate thereof.

BILL NUMBER:S1673

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the general municipal law, in relation to who may conduct games
of bingo

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
Makes certain exceptions for the issuance of licenses for the conduct
of games of bingo.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Amends paragraph (a) of subdivision 1 of section 481 of the general
municipal law by adding language that would provide for an exception
~here the members conducting the bingo are involved in a
rehabilitation program licensed or certified by a state agency.

JUSTIFICATION:
The intent of the original law was to assure that those convicted of a
crime not be able to conduct bingo games. This new language would
provide an exception to the law to allow those convicted of a crime
to conduct bingo if they are involved in a rehabilitation program
licensed or certified by a state agency. This would allow programs
such as Father Young Industries to be able to continue an essential
part of their fundraising program that supports the programs that
serve those convicted of crimes.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2006: S.8252 - Died in Committee
2008: S.2078 - Advanced to Third Reading and Committed to Rules
2009: S.4149 - Died in Committee

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
